lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because:
I believe that to work against poverty and hunger it to work for world peace.
~~~
I loan because of my ethical and religious beliefs. First, I think that fighting poverty and hunger are key aspects of working towards world peace and improving the world. I think that micro-loans are one aspect of that, and are a supplement to traditional charity.

Traditional charity provides the basics. A person without clean water, shelter, food, basic education, or who is dealing with socio-political upheavals (military uprisings, genocides, landmine areas), would need "traditional" charity. This is where we simply help those in grave need. One cannot "make a loan" for clean water, a sanitary latrine, landmine clearing, malaria medications, or dengue fever vaccines. 

The value of Kiva is in areas where there is already an infrastructure and stable (or stable-ish) government and economy. This allows people to raise themselves out of survival and into a more self-sustaining living. With access to small business loans, people can improve not only the lives of their family, but strengthen their immediate community. As people create successful local businesses and services, more money circulates through a community, raising the standard of living.

I do not think that Kiva is a solution to poverty. I do think it is an important tool in fighting poverty, and a way to shrink the edges of poverty, lifting people out of it through their own work. 

My second reason is more religious. I believe that good deeds propagate, and successful loans improve the lives of others indirectly. I do, and always have, believed in reincarnation. I believe we not only have an obligation to improve the world for our children, but also for our souls when they return. I think that by improving the world, we expand the growth possible by successive generations, be they our descendants or ourselves. I think that this kind of mindset is ultimately necessary for mankind. I believe we have to start improving the present so that humankind as a collective can grow.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a hospital. I help keep the computers working.

lenders.name: Sara
lenders.loan_because:
"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed it is the only thing that ever has."
Margaret Mead

Its is an equalizing process, an enriching process, and a humanizing process.

lenders.loan_because: I like my money making a differents.  This is an experiment for me and I view it more positively than just giving a charitable aid.  The old Proverb:  teach someone to fish and they catch fish for a lifetime.
lenders.occupational_info:
Student:  learning to help myself and others.

Security:  What I do to enable me being a student.

lenders.name: Carolina
lenders.loan_because: When you believe in a cause, you cant wait for someone else to solve it.
lenders.occupational_info: Entertaining, full of life, constant contact with people, creative and dynamic.

lenders.name: Montina
lenders.loan_because: I'm paying it forward - I'm passing the gift I was given on to another person.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people heal from physical accidents, recover from emotional traumas, and move towards their goals. I also enjoy taking pictures of Divine Love in action.

lenders.name: George
lenders.loan_because: People have individual value that affects the lives of those around them. Everyone is important to the world around them.
lenders.occupational_info: Aircraft Mechanic, Industrial Maintenance Technician, and RV Technician...

lenders.name: Jean
lenders.loan_because: I'd rather "teach a man to fish".
lenders.occupational_info: Consulting for interactive and game space.

lenders.name: Kelly
lenders.loan_because: We are a fourth grade class who want to help people create a business.
lenders.occupational_info: Elementary teacher

lenders.name: Colm
lenders.loan_because: IT GOES DIRECT TO AN INDIVIDUAL WHO WANT TO ADVANCE THEIR SITUATION AND TAKE CARE OF THEIR FAMILY.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retire professional real estate developer. I have written three teaching e-books and made several CD and DVD that teach individuals how to become developers.

lenders.name: caspar
lenders.loan_because: To help economically less fortunate people

lenders.name: Rachel BoKyoung
lenders.loan_because: I learned many developing countries, and I recognized that there are still a lot of people who suffer from poverty. I really want to help them. To get rid of the poverty, I think we should give them an opportunity to sustain/start their jobs. As a student majoring in Finance, I want to let them know how to manage their business and money successfully if possible. And in the future, I want to establish a microfinance bank for them.
lenders.occupational_info: I currently am a student at University of Southern California, concentrating on Finance and Business Economics.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of micro lending
lenders.occupational_info: I am a college professor and business consultant who specializes in supply chain systems.

lenders.name: Nicholas
lenders.loan_because: This is the best development tool I can think of. It's simple, efficient and brings the money right where it is needed.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a project manager for the local government in the Vaucluse area in the South of France.

lenders.name: ravi
lenders.loan_because:
it can be the answer someone is hoping for, in order to grow their business and get ahead in life - and Kiva really makes it easy to lend & relend the repayments.
"A Kiva gift certificate from Michael Peachey (http://www.kiva.org/lender/mpeachey) was my initial spark. The hardships faced by  Kiva entrepreneurs moved me & I realized that I could reach out via Kiva. At a presentation by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman (http://www.kiva.org/lender/jessica3045),  I learned first-hand how real Kiva is. Empowered, I began exploring more of Kiva."

lenders.name: Christine & Russell
lenders.loan_because: We heard about Kiva by chance on the radio and  how many other aid agencies cannot deliver assistance effectively with any long term benefits. The KIVA model, administration and ease of use was both appealing and engaging. We hope that the contributions made by us will make a sustainable difference to everyone.
lenders.occupational_info: Headteacher; Pub Retailing managing supply chain, recruitment and gaming in the UK

lenders.name: MJ and Tony
lenders.loan_because: It's an awesome thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I stay at home with my kids, my husband, Tony, builds and repairs airplanes.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: it's a way to participate in a productive, sustainable economy.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a family and on the side I volunteer for a citizen's economic justice organization called Attac.

lenders.name: isa
lenders.loan_because: my name is isa , am living in bahrain in the middile east & my father retired + my mother house wife & i have 5 brothers + 3 sisters my father salary not exceeding 200bd & newly i got engaged  & frankly i want to marriage , build house for me & my wife + i am feeling upset ,unsatisfy & i dont know what to di plz plz as much as possible help mey brothers & sisters
